Recap: My product is an ‚ÄúAbdominal Electrical Muscle Stimulator Belt‚Äù that requires an FDA 501(k) certification to seller in the US and on Amazon. I have done extensive research on this matter and confirmed that I will need the FDA 501(k) in order to sell this product to the public as Amazon has categorized this product as a medical device. Up to now, I have resolved all the other problems on the dummy listing except for submitting the FDA 501(k) certification from my supplier to Seller Support Central

(1) Negotiation with supplier for FDA 501(k) certification: In the beginning,  my suppler wanted 50% down payment of the bulk order in order for me to obtain the FDA 501(k) clearance number to test out my listing. After a few days of negotiation, I was able to bring the price down to 30% down payment for the bulk order (which is roughly $2,500), and the supplier will not take anything less than that for the FDA 501k number. Note: This supplier owns the pattern of a product that has been selling on Amazon by another Chinese seller, and the supplier has assured me that the other Chinese seller was able to submit the same FDA 501(k) clearance number and they are currently selling the product on Amazon.

  - 2024-12-29 | 9-5 Job - Don‚Äôt Rush to Quit
Use to build 6-12 month fund as a safety net, allows you to have peace of mind on not getting emotional in decision making
Do not overly invest in 9-5, it‚Äôs all about balance. Opportunity cost of investing more time to focus on your own business vs spending more time only making $xx at corporate. 
Own business has exponential growth, 9-5 has linear growth. Business should exceed 9-5 job income.

Scaling - Build strong systems
Systems must be a well oiled machine with first product before scaling to more
Don‚Äôt fall into shiny object syndrome, searching for next ‚Äúbest thing‚Äù can be a distraction when you are not established yet
Relationship with VAs and SOPS must all be in place 
Philippines or Vietnam $3-5 hourly = low skill, $10 hourly = high skill
Start with lower cost options for VAs to get the experience (don‚Äôt fall into paralysis loop when starting)
Job descriptions = important when hiring, be clear & set clear guidelines & expectations
Once hired, give VA time for adjustment & create opportunities to test them & their abilities. Underperforming = move on (with lower costing VAs) or communicate & set boundaries 
One VA per product = ideal

Sticking to Goals
Create clear & measurable business goals (Journal, Fitness, Wins, Weekly Goals, Daily Twos)
Daily & Weekly schedule to prioritize tasks (Atomic Habits Book will help with this)
Delegate non-core tasks to free up time for scaling (make less decisions, reduce decision fatigue)
Review progress on a regular basis to stay accountable

I am noticing a lot of my sales are going mainly to ad cost which I will definitely need to work on that. Lowering ad cost and getting more organic sales will help a lot.  My net profit so far with 106 units sold is at $1400. I plan on using my profit and credit card to reinvest into this new batch. My question is, how can I continue to have enough capital to keep going that is my main worry at the moment. Any suggestions would be much appreciated! Thank you so much!

  - 2025-02-03 | How to Edit Your FBA Bulk Delivery Window:
1. Log in to Seller Central:
Go to https://sellercentral.amazon.com and sign in with your credentials.
2. Go to the ‚ÄòInventory‚Äô Tab:
Hover over ‚ÄúInventory‚Äù on the top menu and select ‚ÄúManage FBA Shipments.‚Äù
3. Locate Your Shipment Plan:
Find the shipment you want to modify. You can search by Shipment ID or filter by status.
4. Edit Shipment:
Click on the shipment name or ID to open the details.
Select ‚ÄúWork on Shipment‚Äù or ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù depending on the status of the shipment.
5. Adjust Delivery Window:
Scroll to the section where the delivery window is displayed. This is usually in the ‚ÄúShipping‚Äù or ‚ÄúCarrier‚Äù section.
If you‚Äôre using Amazon-partnered carriers, you can adjust the delivery date here.
For non-partnered carriers, you may need to coordinate directly with the carrier.
6. Save Changes:
After editing, click ‚ÄúConfirm‚Äù or ‚ÄúSave & Continue‚Äù to finalize your updates.

  - 2025-01-10 | Hey @everyone 
Unfortunately, the Helium 10 webinar recording wasn‚Äôt shared after the session, but I wanted to share my notes in case they might be helpful to someone.
Since I used a translator, some parts of the information may not be 100% accurate, but I hope it still adds value!
I‚Äôm also attaching an Excel sheet that might be useful for your analysis or work. 

Key Points of the Webinar: Speaker Cyndi Thomason.

1. Profit First Methodology:
Core Principle: Prioritize profit first, then allocate the remaining funds for expenses.
Parkinson's Law: Expenses always grow to match available resources. Separating cash flows helps control spending.
Key Strategy: Use bank accounts to allocate funds:
Main account (operating expenses).
Inventory account.
Profit account.

2. Cash Flow Management Recommendations:
Separate expenses: Create individual bank accounts for inventory and operating expenses.
Quarterly Profit Distributions: Use half for personal needs, leave the other half in a reserve fund.
Perform regular expense reviews (quarterly) to identify and cut unnecessary costs.
Set aside a percentage of revenue (e.g., 1% initially) for the profit account.

3. Credit Card Recommendations: This method defently she learned from <@975774205658411068> 
Use separate credit cards for inventory and operating expenses.
Monitor credit use carefully to avoid cash flow disruptions.

4. Budget Allocation:
After setting aside funds for inventory, allocate the remaining balance as follows:
Profit: 5‚Äì15%.
Owner‚Äôs pay.
Taxes.
Operating expenses (lowest priority).

5. Product Optimization:
Regularly assess product profitability, especially for the top 10% and bottom 10% of your inventory.
Periodically review pricing and costs for each product.
Plan for profitability during the product development stage.

6. Calculation Tools:
Owner Pay Calculator: Helps determine how much you can pay yourself based on revenue and margins.
Use calculators to assess costs and product profitability, available on the speaker‚Äôs website.

7. Key Recommendations:
Build a business focused on profitability, not just revenue growth.
Pay yourself to ensure your business does not become an "expensive hobby."
Create reserve funds to cover unforeseen expenses.

8. Long-term Investments:
Profit accounts can be used for investments (bonds, funds), but ensure you have liquid funds for emergencies.

  - 2025-02-17 | <@1292032925964959755>  Key Takeaway üîë dear!

  - 2025-02-17 | You are welcome  dear üòä
  - 2025-02-17 | Key Takeaways from Monday Motivation Session with Charlie

1. Real Connection Matters More Than Digital One
In today's world, we are "connected" through social media but rarely engage in meaningful interactions.
It‚Äôs important to have real conversations, turn on the camera, and see people‚Äôs emotions and reactions.

2. Movement and Breathing for Energy and Clarity
Before starting important work, it‚Äôs beneficial to stretch or do light exercises.
Deep breathing helps improve focus, relax, and cultivate gratitude for the present moment.

3. Gratitude as a Tool for Success
Practicing gratitude daily helps recognize the positive moments and opportunities we have.
Many people in the world don‚Äôt have the same opportunities, so it‚Äôs important to appreciate what we do have.

4. Entrepreneurship = Leadership
Being an entrepreneur is hard because you have to lead yourself.
We are used to being guided by parents, school, or work, but as entrepreneurs, we must take full responsibility for our own direction.

5. Stress is a Growth Tool, Not an Enemy
Stress is not our enemy; it is the key to unlocking our potential.
Research shows that people who believe stress is harmful have a 43% increased risk of premature death.
Those who see stress as a challenge don‚Äôt suffer from it but instead grow stronger.

6. Change Your Perspective on Stress
Example: Two bricklayers do the same job‚Äîone just lays bricks, the other builds a cathedral.
Change your mindset: Stress is not a problem; it‚Äôs an opportunity to grow.

7. Eliminate Unnecessary Stress
There is valuable stress (which helps us grow) and non-valuable stress (which drains us).
Unnecessary stress includes:
Worrying about things you can‚Äôt control.
Holding onto resentment and negativity.
Constantly comparing yourself to others.
Perfectionism and fear of mistakes.

8. Action is the Best Cure
Don‚Äôt dwell on the past‚Äîact.
Stress from inactivity is worse than stress from progress.

9. Growth Comes Through Struggles
No growth without challenges: muscles grow from strain, and a butterfly becomes strong by struggling out of its cocoon.
The harder the journey, the stronger you become.

10. Let Go of Unnecessary Weight
Anger, grudges, and regrets are like a heavy backpack that holds you back.
Forgiveness is not for others‚Äîit‚Äôs for your own peace.

11. Reflection Questions:
What stress in my life is helping me grow?
What stress do I need to let go of?
How can I shift my mindset so stress works for me, not against me?
  - 2025-02-07 | <@750566740424917045>
  - 2025-01-24 | Thank you dear Susan ‚ù§Ô∏èüëå
  - 2025-02-08 | 7. The Power of Reviews & Long-Term Reputation
A great dish (product) needs appealing presentation (listing) and positive reviews (reputation).
Customers trust reviews‚Äîthe more 5-star ratings you have, the stronger your sales will be.
Aim for at least 50 reviews as quickly as possible for stability and profitability.
Key Lesson: Amazon success is a marathon, not a sprint.
Final Takeaways: Your Entrepreneur‚Äôs Checklist
‚úÖ Daily affirmations & physical movement to start the day
‚úÖ Avoid distractions (reduce phone use before bed)
‚úÖ Find an accountability partner
‚úÖ Focus on high-impact activities (20%) that drive 80% of results
‚úÖ Optimize your Amazon listing by studying successful competitors
‚úÖ Invest in high-quality images, strong bundling, and compelling descriptions
‚úÖ PPC only amplifies what already works‚Äîoptimize before spending big
‚úÖ Reviews = Reputation. Aim for 50+ reviews to solidify credibility
‚úÖ Keep improving. Amazon success is built over months, not weeks.
Your Challenge:
For the next 7 days, apply one of these principles and track your progress. Small daily improvements lead to massive long-term success.
Closing Thought:
"Entrepreneurship is not about how fast you win‚Äîit‚Äôs about who keeps improving until they succeed."
  - 2025-02-08 | SHIFU Saturday Membership Recap: Key Insights for Entrepreneurs

1. The Power of Self-Affirmation and Physical Readiness
Entrepreneurship demands not just strategic thinking but also mental resilience. The session began with a crucial reminder: affirmations matter. You must tell yourself daily:
‚úîÔ∏è "I am smart, capable, and ready to achieve great things."
‚úîÔ∏è "I am the best version of myself, and I will keep improving."

2. Comfort vs. Growth: The Entrepreneur‚Äôs Challenge
One of the most striking messages was about the danger of comfort. Growth comes from pushing beyond what feels easy.
‚ñ∂Ô∏è "Comfort is the enemy of progress."
Much like how pressure transforms coal into diamonds, challenges shape an entrepreneur‚Äôs journey. If you signed up to build a business, expect obstacles‚Äîdaily. The key is how you respond to them.
‚úîÔ∏è Meditation & Clarity ‚Äì Take time to reflect, put away distractions (especially your phone), and breathe deeply. This reduces stress and increases focus.
‚úîÔ∏è Disrupt Bad Habits ‚Äì Try not using your phone before bed for 7 days and observe how it impacts your focus and productivity.

3. Accountability & Community Support
Being part of a supportive community increases your chances of success. 
Task: Find an accountability partner and commit to checking in with them regularly.

4. The Amazon Success Formula: 80/20 Rule
Entrepreneurs often confuse being busy with being productive. The Pareto Principle (80/20 Rule) applies to Amazon success:
‚úîÔ∏è 20% of your actions drive 80% of your results.
‚úîÔ∏è Focus on what moves the needle, not on distractions.
‚ñ∂Ô∏è Top 3 Priorities for Amazon Sellers:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Product Excellence ‚Äì Choose or refine a product with high demand.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Listing Optimization ‚Äì Create engaging, high-quality images, infographics, and compelling copy.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Strategic Marketing ‚Äì Invest in PPC campaigns strategically (not blindly).

5. Amazon Listing Strategy: Studying the ‚ÄúSmart Kids‚Äù
One of the most valuable insights from this session was how to optimize your product listing.
‚úîÔ∏è Find the ‚ÄòSmart Kids‚Äô (Successful Competitors)
Look for competitors with high sales but fewer reviews‚Äîthese sellers are doing something right.
Study their bundling strategies, pricing, and presentation.
‚úîÔ∏è Invest in High-Quality Images & Infographics
The first product image must be eye-catching and clearly communicate value.
Infographics should emphasize why your product is better.
Show bundled items visually, as customers buy based on perceived value.
‚úîÔ∏è Understand Customer Behavior
Women tend to invest more in beauty, while pet owners often prioritize budget-friendly products.
The Blue Ocean Strategy teaches differentiation: instead of competing directly, find a unique angle.

6. PPC & ACoS: The Metrics That Matter
‚ñ∂Ô∏è PPC is an Amplifier, Not a Solution
If your product & listing are weak, PPC will not save you‚Äîit will just burn money faster.
If your foundation is strong, PPC will amplify success.
‚ñ∂Ô∏è Understanding ACoS (Advertising Cost of Sales)
If you spend $10 and attract 10 people but only 3 buy, your ACoS is 30%.
A high ACoS (above 70%) indicates poor listing optimization, weak offer, or pricing issues.
A good target ACoS for beginners is 30-50%, improving over time with better listing and optimization.
‚ñ∂Ô∏è Optimization Steps
‚úîÔ∏è Adjust pricing
‚úîÔ∏è Improve images & bundling
‚úîÔ∏è Get more reviews
Takeaway: If after two months your ACoS is still above 100%, schedule a call with a coach for a listing audit.
  - 2025-01-25 | Saturday Session from <@1066465177140215928> üêùüë∏

1. Handling Supplier Issues:
Problem: A shipment of 3,000 units had a critical issue‚ÄîEuropean plugs were used instead of U.S. plugs.

Resolution Options:
1. Intercept the goods before delivery to Amazon, fix the plugs via a 3PL (third-party logistics), and repackage.

2. Allow the goods to reach Amazon, then remove them for rework.

3. Ship the goods back to the seller directly.
Chosen Solution: Intercept the goods and fix the issue with a 3PL provider to avoid delays and additional handling costs.

2. Negotiation Tactics:
Negotiation with Supplier:
Susan‚Äôs goal was to have the supplier cover 100% of the costs or at least 80%.
Strategy included highlighting her investment in their partnership (e.g., over $200,000 spent on orders).
Mentioned exploring alternative suppliers to create leverage.
Outcome: The supplier agreed to cover the full cost of $3,200 for fixing the plugs.
Payment Terms: Negotiated a partial 30-day payment term, paying $5,000 out of a $15,000 invoice after 30 days, with plans to renegotiate for better terms in future orders.

3. Leveraging Third-Party Logistics (3PL):
Susan found a 3PL provider, Jimmy, who offered a cost-effective solution.
Jimmy‚Äôs team handled:
Inspecting and reworking the goods (swapping out plugs).
Preparing the goods for Amazon shipment.
Ensuring customs clearance and smooth logistics.

4. Building Supplier Relationships:
Key Relationship Practices:
Use a sourcing agent (Macy) to handle supplier negotiations and logistics.
Regularly negotiate pricing and payment terms.
Demonstrate growth potential (e.g., expanding sales channels like TikTok, Etsy, and Walmart).
Maintain a positive, professional relationship to foster long-term trust and collaboration.

5. Strategic Insights:
Negotiation Mindset:
Always give before asking‚Äîinvest time and money to build trust with suppliers.
Showcase that you‚Äôre a valuable partner by highlighting your order volume and growth potential.
Alternatives: Actively seek new suppliers as leverage to show your current supplier they are not your only option.

6. Key Takeaways from Mentorship (Justin‚Äôs Advice):
Be willing to walk away from a deal if necessary.
Focus on building strong relationships and demonstrating consistent performance.
Keep multiple options open to avoid dependency on one supplier.
Treat every challenge as an opportunity to learn and improve negotiation skills.

7. Cost of Doing Business:
Accept that mistakes and unforeseen issues are part of running a business.
Minimize the impact of problems by negotiating favorable terms and finding creative solutions.

8. Personal Development and Accountability:
Susan‚Äôs Example: By staying calm and strategic, she managed a complex issue effectively.
Accountability Partner: Having someone to hold you accountable and offer support is crucial in overcoming challenges.

9. Practical Advice for Students:
Using Tools: Employ 3PL providers and sourcing agents to handle logistics efficiently.

Networking: Build relationships with suppliers, agents, and mentors to expand opportunities.

Mindset: Stay patient and focused, as success requires consistent effort and long-term planning.
  - 2025-01-25 | Overview and Structure of the Saturday Session from <@975774205658411068> 

1. Basics of Selling on Amazon:
Product Selection: The product should have potential, and it‚Äôs essential to highlight its advantages compared to competitors.
Listing Quality: Ensure your listing (images, description) is professionally crafted. This is the foundation for a successful launch.
Pricing: Your price should be competitive and reasonable to minimize customer resistance to purchase.

2. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):
KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) show how effectively your business is performing. The main metrics include:
ACoS: Advertising Cost of Sales. An ideal ACoS is below 100% during the launch phase.
Organic and Sponsored Sales: Compare the share of organic sales with sales through advertising. Gradual growth in organic sales to 30-40% indicates increasing reputation.

3. Automation and Tools:
Sell Board: A tool for tracking sales data, costs, and profits.
Helium 10: Useful for data analysis, tracking returns, and improving marketing campaigns.
A/B Testing (PickFu): Use it to test and optimize images for better performance.

4. Importance of Mentorship and Relationships:
Building relationships with mentors and other business participants is key to success.
Collaboration: Work with other sellers instead of competing directly.
Mentorship Approach: Form your own opinions based on the knowledge you gain.

5. Setting Realistic Goals:
Don‚Äôt expect instant profit. The initial goal is to break even.
Review sales data monthly and track profit growth.

6. Managing Risks:
For beginners, it‚Äôs crucial to choose less competitive niches to reduce risks.
Start with smaller volumes and less costly campaigns (e.g., with low cost-per-click).

7. Quality Control and Logistics:
Quality control of the first batch is critically important. Defective goods can harm your reputation.
Work with reliable suppliers and use sourcing agents to improve terms.

8. Product and Advertising Management:
Use auto and manual PPC campaigns. Auto campaigns help find keywords, while manual campaigns strengthen successful strategies.
Focus on targeting competitors through ASIN campaigns.

9. Philosophy and Long-Term Strategy:
Business is a marathon, not a sprint. Don‚Äôt rush to expand your product line until the first product is successful.
Learn to manage expectations and build brand reputation.

10. Personal Growth and Success Mindset:
Positive Image: Be friendly and resolve conflicts publicly with dignity.
Focus: Stay focused on long-term goals and avoid distractions.
Self-Development: Learn from successful people and strengthen your skills.
  - 2025-01-11 | Overview and Structure of the Saturday Session from <@975774205658411068> 

Main Topics:
1. Motivation and Psychological Preparation.
2. Principles of A/B Testing for Amazon.
3. KPI (Key Performance Indicators) and Their Analysis.
4. Time Management and Creating a Productive Environment.
5. Goal Setting, Habit Control, and Eliminating Distractions.

Training Stages and Key Points:
1. Motivation and Psychological Preparation:
Goal: Understanding the importance of change and taking responsibility for success.
Key Takeaways:
Change starts with self-awareness and recognizing personal weaknesses.
Habits are formed through daily actions.
Environment and surroundings significantly influence success: remove negativity and surround yourself with positivity.
Setting the right mindset begins with small changes (e.g., replacing music or improving your surroundings).

2. Principles of A/B Testing for Amazon:
Goal: Optimize your listing and increase sales.
Key Points:
What is A/B Testing? Comparing two options (e.g., images, titles, descriptions) to identify the most effective one.
When to Apply: After the first month of sales to identify areas for improvement.
What to Test:
1. Images (affect clicks and purchasing decisions).
2. Titles (handle changes carefully to avoid disrupting Amazon‚Äôs algorithms).
3. Product descriptions (highlight uniqueness and reduce risks for the buyer).
Tools: Use Helium 10 for competitor analysis and PickFu for audience testing.

3. KPI (Key Performance Indicators) and Their Analysis:
Goal: Understand your business's effectiveness.
Key Metrics:
1. Sales (overall, organic, and sponsored).
2. ACoS (advertising cost of sales).
3. Profitability (analyze revenue and expenses).
Tools: Utilize tools like Sellerboard to visualize data and analyze KPIs.

4. Time Management and Creating a Productive Environment:
Goal: Use time and energy as efficiently as possible.
Practical Tips:
Create a schedule with clear time allocations (work, learning, rest).
Remove distractions (delete unnecessary apps, establish a dedicated workspace).
Learn from successful people (e.g., other students in the Academy).
Find an accountability partner for mutual support.

5. Goal Setting and Eliminating Distractions:
Goal: Develop the right habits and actions.
Steps:
1. Audit Your Environment: Identify who or what has a positive/negative influence on you.
2. Eliminate Distractions: Remove or minimize temptations.
3. Set Mini-Goals: Break down big goals into smaller tasks with a system of rewards and penalties.
4. Control Your Emotions: Understand triggers and manage reactions effectively.


Practical Tasks for Students:
1. Create a Schedule: Determine how to allocate your day for maximum efficiency.
2. Conduct an Environmental Audit: Make a list of positive and negative influences.
3. Start A/B Testing: Select one listing element for testing.
4. Set a Weekly Goal: For example, improving one KPI.
5. Change Your Surroundings: Eliminate distractions (e.g., music, social media, etc.)
Conclusion:
This session focused on a comprehensive approach to success, from internal self-analysis to practical tools. Following these steps will create a solid foundation for your business and personal growth.
  - 2024-12-29 | Don‚Äôt Rush to Quit the 9-5 Job. Class today with <@975774205658411068> üèÜ

1. Wait for consistent income: Your business should consistently generate income equal to or exceeding your job salary for 6+ months before leaving.

2. Build an emergency fund: Save at least 6-12 months‚Äô worth of expenses before quitting your job.

3. Use your current job as a tool: Your 9-5 income helps fund and test business ideas without emotional pressure.

4. Balance your time: Avoid over-investing in your 9-5 job. Consider the opportunity cost of time that could be used to grow your business.

5. Make data-driven decisions, not emotional ones: Ensure your transition is based on financial stability and business growth potential.

Scaling the Business
1. Create sustainable systems: Before expanding your business or adding new products, ensure current operations run smoothly.

2. Strategic hiring of VAs:
Hire virtual assistants (VAs) based on their skills and rates:
üö©Low-skill: $3‚Äì5/hour (Philippines, Vietnam).
üö©High-skill: ~$10/hour.
Start small by assigning weekend tasks to test their proactivity and work ethic.
Clearly define job descriptions and expectations during the hiring process.

3. Plan for scaling:
Assign one VA per product.
Develop standard operating procedures (SOPs) for all processes.
Ensure a product is profitable and established before launching the next one.

4. Avoid distractions: Stay away from "shiny object syndrome" ‚Äî new ideas that divert focus from your core business.


Delegation and Simplification
1. Optimize tasks:
Create clear daily and weekly schedules.
Delegate non-core tasks to focus on scaling the business.

2. Reduce decision-making:
Simplify everyday choices (e.g., wear only black and white shirts).
Use "Atomic Habits" to build sustainable routines.üìñ

3. Seek support: Ask family members to assist with routine tasks, freeing up time for business priorities.

Relationships and Approach in Business
1. Build long-term relationships:
Avoid making snap judgments about people based on rumors or initial impressions.
Don‚Äôt burn bridges, even if someone is challenging to work with. Approach relationships with respect and understanding.

2. Work collaboratively: Foster positive connections, as they may become valuable in the future.

Focus on Goals 
1. Clarify goals: Set measurable business goals (e.g., document achievements, daily and weekly tasks in a journal).

2. Regular progress reviews: Assess your accomplishments to stay aligned with your objectives.

3. Consistency and discipline: Use schedules and habits to maximize productivity.

üèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜMain Takeaway: Before leaving your job, establish a strong foundation for your business. Strong systems, consistent income, strategic scaling, and a focus on long-term strategy are the keys to success.

  - 2024-12-05 | Please watch video first!

1. Go to the Help Section:
In your Amazon Seller Central account, open the Help tab.
2. Find the Get Help and Resources Section.
3. Why Not Open a Case:
Opening a case can take too long and delay the resolution. Instead, it‚Äôs more effective to call Amazon Support directly.
4. How to Prepare for the Call:

Identify the issue: For example, specify Issue with Asset for Premium A Plus.

Provide the ASIN for the product in question.

Prepare your phone number for the callback.
5. Steps to Make the Call:

Click Call me now and make sure you are near your phone.
Be ready to answer the call and explain the issue in detail.
6. Specifics of Calling Amazon Support:
In some cases, it might take multiple calls as the first consultant might not be qualified to resolve the issue.

If the consultant says they cannot help, thank them politely, hang up, and repeat the process by submitting the form again.

7. My Experience Resolving the Issue:
I had to make calls for about 4-5 hours and speak to over 15 different people before reaching the right specialist.
The specialist immediately filled out the form from their side, and within a few hours, my listing had access to Premium A Plus.
8. Advice:
Don‚Äôt give up after the first attempt. Keep calling until you reach a consultant who can assist.
Emphasize that Premium A Plus access must be updated directly on Amazon‚Äôs end.

2. Instagram posts
  - 2025-02-14 | ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è
Key Takeaways from Bernard‚Äôs PPC Podcast 
üèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜüèÜ
1. A Proper PPC Launch Strategy is Key to Success
‚Ä¢ Three-Phase PPC Strategy: 
‚Ä¢ Phase 1 (Launch & Initial Ranking):
‚Ä¢ Use only Exact Match campaigns for the initial push.
‚Ä¢ Campaigns should be focused on highly relevant keywords (up to 50-100 keywords).
‚Ä¢ Do not mix different keyword intents (e.g., ‚Äúmen‚Äôs running shoes‚Äù and ‚Äúwomen‚Äôs running shoes‚Äù should not be in the same campaign).
‚Ä¢ Avoid automation until you understand what works.
‚Ä¢ Phase 2 (Expansion & Optimization):
‚Ä¢ Add Phrase Match and Broad Match campaigns.
‚Ä¢ Use Sponsored Products and ASIN Targeting.
‚Ä¢ Enroll in Vine to gather reviews, as conversion rates significantly improve after the first 10-20 reviews.
‚Ä¢ Phase 3 (Profit Optimization & Scaling):
‚Ä¢ The goal is to reduce PPC costs and increase organic sales.
‚Ä¢ Track TACOS, ACOS, and organic ranking metrics.
‚Ä¢ Introduce automation only after solid data is available.
‚Ä¢ Use Keyword Harvesting ‚Äì move successful keywords into new campaigns and test them in different match types.
2. Understanding Product Positioning & Amazon‚Äôs Algorithm
‚Ä¢ Amazon‚Äôs ranking algorithm prioritizes recent sales over historical performance. 
‚Ä¢ Maintaining consistent daily sales is crucial for sustained ranking.
‚Ä¢ Amazon has new title requirements: 
‚Ä¢ Limited to 200 characters.
‚Ä¢ Cannot repeat the same keyword multiple times.
‚Ä¢ Certain special characters and words are now prohibited.
3. How to Reduce Wasted Ad Spend & Improve Profitability
‚Ä¢ Use N-gram analysis to identify irrelevant keywords (e.g., if your product is not organic, negative match "organic").
‚Ä¢ Do NOT rely on Amazon‚Äôs suggested bids ‚Äì they are often inflated, sometimes up to $40 per click. Instead: 
‚Ä¢ Aim for 85% of the suggested bid as a starting point.
‚Ä¢ Keep the launch budget at $200-250 per day for a proper PPC launch.
‚Ä¢ For high ACOS keywords: 
‚Ä¢ Move them to separate campaigns and lower bids manually.
4. Relaunch Strategy After Running Out of Stock
‚Ä¢ If a product was out of stock for 1-2 months, don‚Äôt start from scratch, but: 
‚Ä¢ Increase bids by 25-30% to regain ranking.
‚Ä¢ Focus on Exact Match and ASIN Targeting campaigns.
‚Ä¢ DO NOT run video ads or brand ads until organic traffic is restored.
5. When & How to Use Different Ad Types
‚Ä¢ Sponsored Products ‚Äì Essential for ranking; should be launched from day one.
‚Ä¢ Sponsored Brands Video ‚Äì Works well only if the product requires explanation.
‚Ä¢ Sponsored Brands ‚Äì Useful for scaling but not ranking.
‚Ä¢ Sponsored Display ‚Äì Primarily for brand defense, not growth.
6. Advice for Beginners
‚Ä¢ Do NOT outsource PPC at the beginning ‚Äì you must understand the basics first.
‚Ä¢ Learn and test on your own before delegating.
‚Ä¢ PPC success depends on the right product selection, optimized listing, and reviews ‚Äì not just ads.

  - 2025-02-01 | Thank you Shifu!

To be honest, I did not do something new for this batch. I have the same ppc campaign and no new keywords either. I actually slowed down my sales by increasing my price and decreasing my ppc budget because I did not expect my sales velocity to be double/triple from my first batch and I don‚Äôt want to be sold out again to avoid losing ranking. However, I‚Äôm still going to be sold out for a month or two due to lunar new year and unexpected increase in sales per day.

My product is somehow related to health/nutrition and I think I got lucky with the demand of the ‚ÄúNew year, new me‚Äù people for January 2025 which increased my sales. I think what I did differently this time is collecting FBM reviews which builds more trust with my product/brand and also helped increased my sales. I also increase my gift card from 10$ to 20$ in my manychat flow to help gather more reviews, but for some reason, some customers still does not want to leave a review haha. Lastly, I provide good customer service. If I get inquiry for my product I reply as fast as I can (10 minutes or less) and answer all their questions which shows that I am knowledgeable with my product. 

If there are manufacturing error such as defective units, missing product add-ons. I send replacements right away. Sometimes, I give them gift cards as a form of apology for our error and as a thank you for being a great customer and reaching out to me instead of sending back the product to amazon right away. I think losing some profit in return for customer‚Äôs satisfaction is worth it in the long run. I‚Äôd rather have less profit at first then earn 2 or 3x more in the long run.

  - 2024-12-04 | 
  - 2024-12-04 | Hi all, I want to share some tips part 2üòÇ 

If you've had your listing done but don't like it, or if you want to change it to match a seasonal theme on a short budget, or if you're having trouble finding a good listing agent to redo it, here's what I find helpful.

Ask your listing agent for all the product photos and 3D images (or any other images) with a white background.
(You can use a tool like PhotoRoom to remove the background, but for me, it's not ideal since it doesn't allow me to control what to keep or remove from the image.- still learning how to use it correctly)

Use Canva to edit or change the theme of your listing images, and/or RESIZE them for premium A+ content.

This way, you can save money and customize your listing exactly how you want it. Of course, you can't change the entire listing this way, but it can help you improve and update certain parts without breaking the bank. This is just an example but at least make listing image look more appealing
  - 2024-12-04 | For anyone newly launching a product on H10, I find the Xray Keywords feature extremely helpful. You can run Xray Keywords on competitor listings to find performance keywords that are generating sales for the product. By adding these keywords to your PPC campaigns, you can leverage competitor data to boost sales of your own product.
If you have the H10 Diamond Plan, you can also see the competitor's bids for each keyword, giving you even more insights to optimize your PPC strategy.

  - 2025-02-15 | Hi everyone, I want to share tips for unsellable returned items-
You can donate items to charity and write them off as a tax deduction at the end of the year, regardless of the amount. For product accessories or bundled items, you can send them to customers as replacements for missing or broken parts. You can also create a new SKU and sell the bundled items/ parts as new, which can also help enhance your brand‚Äôs page or appearance- making it seem more established and trustworthy, rather than appearing as a new seller. It's better if your brand offers multiple products rather than just one.

  - 2025-02-20 | Yes exactly we have to test and see what works and what doesn‚Äôt. At the end we learn more and keep on improving
  - 2025-02-20 | PS I‚Äôm  not a PPC master
  - 2025-02-20 | If I see I can put in more budget I will turn on asin campaign and so on.
  - 2025-02-20 | In summary the key takeaways from this class were:
1. when launching focus on exact kws campaign because they are the ones who help you rank organically. Max 10 KW per category as much campaigns as you need depending on your product. 
2. Every kw needs time to be tested , so 10/day budget and see which is a bleeder. Basically test and proven campings 
3. Don‚Äôt do SB videos until you gain organic sales. But at the end he says not necessary 
4. Focus on ranking organically as fast as possible. After ranking can distribuir the budget for board ohrase and other campaigns 
5. Use the search query report to look at what customers are searching for 
6. -15% of suggested bid and bids down

So taking in consideration of this , I created 3 more exact campaigns with 10/day and see how it goes. Also from my first launch I looked at my spends on each campaign and took out everything that‚Äôs not converting and only left the ones that sold. Only since budget it‚Äôs tight I only have my broad and phrase and exact campaign which are the ones that covert the most for my case from first launch plus the 3 new exact campings.

  - 2025-02-03 | I believe only the ones damaged by warehouse.
  - 2025-01-17 | I did 3$ dollars every 3 days progressively, and funny I still had sells so I kept on increasing until I got zero products left üòÇ
  - 2025-01-17 | For you it‚Äôs important to keep the kw ranking for the coming batch so you don‚Äôt loose momentum
  - 2025-01-17 | Yes exactly, the difference for me is that I will drastically lower the budget and increase price to maximize profit and knowing full well that my next batch is not coming soon so no point in trying to keep the kw ranking
  - 2025-01-17 | I think it‚Äôs best to increase price and lower budget. This way you slowly decrease your sales velocity and depending on the arrival time, see what works best to not loose kw ranking which you want to keep for the next coming batch

Greetings,

First of all, pardon me for my delayed response. Please note that my working hours align with US timings, as the majority of my clients are from the US. You will receive instant responses from me during my working hours. 

Anyway, after reviewing all the details you shared, I need you to know one thing, and this is the core of my years of experience in this niche, the way Amazon works, you need to accept the guilt. If you don't want to accept the guilt, you must provide a very high level of documentary proof that you are not guilty.

In your case, there is a violation, so I recommend acknowledging the mistake and proposing drastic measures to assure Amazon that you will no longer pose a risk of repeating the same mistake.

The Amazon team may already have that order ID in their records, and there is a possibility they will only accept the appeal if the violation is acknowledged. I think you need to send all the required details along with a very strong plan of action.

  - 2024-12-15 | Possible Root Cause of Violation:
The language used in the product insert card may have caused misunderstanding, as well as I was not aware that redirecting customers using Facebook messenger to register lifetime warranty was not allowed.
  - 2024-12-15 | None of our products have been associated with incentives for positive reviews or any form of review manipulation. We only offered a lifetime warranty for ASIN: B0CRDLWZRY, without asking for any type of review (please see previous screenshots of QR End-to-end experience).
  - 2024-12-15 | - https://www.amazon.com/gp/help/customer/display.html?ref_=hp_left_v4_sib&nodeId=G8CXDFT9GLRRSV3G
- And all other relevant policies.

Addition to that, as per your questions in the submission please see the following:

1. Methods Used to Obtain Customer Information:
We did not use any methods to collect customers‚Äô personal information for incentivizing or manipulating reviews. The QR code on our product insert is solely for directing customers to register for a manufacturer‚Äôs lifetime warranty. It does not collect information for review purposes.
    
2. Start Date for Product Review Abuse:
There has been no product review abuse from our side. We have never incentivized or asked customers for reviews.
    
3. Third-Party Contact Information:
No third-party services, companies, or external groups were used to obtain customer personal information or solicit reviews.
    
4. Documentation from Third Parties:
Since no third parties were involved, there are no documents, emails, or receipts related to such services.
    
5. Documents, QR Code End-to-End Experience:
I have attached screenshots in my previous appeal showing the full experience of the QR code flow. It directs customers to register for their lifetime warranty, without mentioning reviews or asking for them. We also never obtained any personal information from customers, other than their Order ID, just so we can take note of customers' future warranty claims.
    
6. List of Order IDs and Reviews Obtained Prohibitedly:
There are no Order IDs or reviews that were obtained through prohibited methods, as we have never engaged in such activities.
  
7. List of all products where you have asked for positive reviews or offered any incentives, such as discounts, free products, or other benefits, to customers in exchange for them writing product reviews.
  - 2024-12-15 | Hi Amazon Team, 

It was really nice speaking with you on the phone. Thank you so much for clarifying my queries before I send out another appeal. As requested and understood, here are the responses to your queries:

Corrective Actions and Prevention Plan

Possible Root Cause of Violation:
The language used in the product insert card may have caused misunderstanding.

Action Plan:
1. Withdraw and Inspect Units - Retrieve units and inspect them to remove existing insert cards that has any misleading language. (Removal order ID: 241211122C)

2. Redesign Insert Card - Create a new insert card by this coming week that avoids any misleading language that might encourage customers to leave a review, and to focus strictly solely on highlighting the lifetime warranty offered to them without any other misleading language.

3. Restricted Communications: All our team members have been informed that all customer communication will occur only through Amazon‚Äôs messaging tools, even when they request for an exchange of a faulty product to claim the warranty is to be communicated via Amazon channel only.

4. Regular Training: Our team will undergo detailed training bi-weekly starting Monday 16th December 2024 on Amazon‚Äôs policies to avoid future violations. We will also conduct a monthly seminar to train our team on any updated or new policies implemented by Amazon. Below are some of the many links to the policies and content related to this matter we will be training our staff with, starting this coming Monday the 16th of December. 

- https://sellercentral.amazon.com/help/hub/reference/YRKB5RU3FS5TURN

  - 2025-02-05 | Also contacted the support att amazon who responded with this:

    

Hello from Amazon Brand Registry Support,

Thank you for contacting us, This is Madhumitha

We understand your issue is regarding ASIN not recognized as part of my brand

Please be informed that, when the ASIN is not properly being mapped to your brand you receive this error
This is usually caused by inaccurate listing data on the ASIN, which you can fix by editing. The most common data points that need updating are:

Brand name mismatch: The brand name listed on the ASIN does not match the brand name as approved by Amazon's Brand Registry. These need to match 100%. Adding spaces or hyphens will lead to a mismatch.
Note: Brand name is case sensitive.
Inaccurate GTIN or Key Attribute. Your ASIN listing data must include a GTIN (UPC, EAN, JAN) that is correct and consistent with your brand. The most common GTIN/Key Attributes are:
UPC
Part number
Model number
Style number
Catalog number
Categorization: The item type category which closely matches with the ASIN product type should be selected in the listing details.

  - 2025-01-28 | I think it will cause the product pool to shrink, it's already challenging enough to find a viable product to begin with base on current conditions, CPC will naturally be aligned to it's respective market, base on price and demand...a high CPC can indicate high demand, high competition but doesn't necessarily mean it's bad, just a different set of challenges in the market and if one can stand out in this particular market, the product can thrive but on the flip side, it can net lower margins, limit differentiation, etc...same thing can go wiith lower CPC...it could possibly indicate lower demand, low competition, low buyer intent, etc. but a product can thrive in this market as well....either case, when done right, can potentially net positive outcomes so I personally think limiting to just low CPC limits opportunities...just my 2 cents
  - 2024-12-18 | Yes

  - 2025-02-20 | Phuong has it right. Just submit your invoice from your supplier and let them know the total cost for each unit. They will reimburse you for the lost units. If they eventually locate the lost units, they will just charge back for the reimbursement.
  - 2025-02-14 | My forwarder gave me the option of regular sea, Matson, or air. I chose Matson cause it was faster than regular and only a little more expensive. Also, my forwarder said when shipping to the West warehouses, transferring to truck when it hits the port is faster than UPS and is cheaper. UPS is best for east coast according to him. So I go with Matson + truck shipping.
  - 2025-02-12 | I‚Äôve only shipped by Matson, which is considered a faster sea shipping. So I have nothing else to compare to sea-wise.
  - 2025-02-12 | I‚Äôm glad Eleni answered your questions. Just wanted to add that if you don‚Äôt like the warehouse locations they‚Äôre being sent to, you can redo the form and sometimes they will shuffle around the arrangements to different warehouses.

I had to do this a few times cause my forwarder said one that was chosen was a newer warehouse, which he recommended to avoid.
  - 2025-02-11 | But I hope your experience is different!
  - 2025-02-11 | I also want to add something to consider.  Based on my experience with air shipping, I‚Äôd only do it if you currently have inventory and are trying to not sell out. 

If you‚Äôre already sold out then the price difference isn‚Äôt really worth the  extra week or so of getting your inventory.

My air shipping was estimated for 15-20 days and sea was 30-40 days. My air shipping arrived after 20 days and my sea arrived after 35 days. After Amazon processing, air shipping only beat sea by ~7 days. It wasn‚Äôt worth the extra $1000 for me üòî
  - 2025-02-11 | Haha I‚Äôm glad I clarified! You‚Äôre very welcome.

You‚Äôll fill out the ‚Äúsend to Amazon‚Äù form twice. One with the fast shipping details and one with the regular sea shipping details.

  - 2024-12-04 | This is a response from my lawyers when I wanted to remove assigned search codes:

‚ÄúThere is a mechanism to delete design search codes. However, the deletion is a separate submission and a brief justification as to the request must be made under Trademark Office rules. The design search codes were selected by the Trademark Office. As reflected in the Official USPTO Notice of Design Search Code, ‚Äúassigning design search codes to your mark helps us [the USPTO] more effectively search our database for marks that may conflict with yours. Design search codes have no legal significance and will not appear on the registration certificate.‚Äù (Emphasis added.)
 
Given that the likelihood-of-confusion 2(d) search has already been conducted, the design search codes are now moot. However, if you would nonetheless like us to attempt to have them removed from the record, our quote would be $300. We ask that you provide us with the ‚Äújustification‚Äù for removing the design codes as required by the USPTO. (It seems to us that keeping the design search codes is beneficial to you, since it shows that the Examining Attorney conducted a broader, wider search when considering likelihood of confusion. But the decision of whether to proceed with their removal is yours.)‚Äù
  - 2024-12-04 | Woohoo! Congratulations! That means they‚Äôre processing your application and it‚Äôs moving towards publication.

As Han said, forward that to your ip lawyer so they can respond to the Office Action.
  - 2025-01-30 | Hi Helena, the way to calculate it is to get the cost from Amazon for each shipment option when you fill out the ‚ÄúSend to Amazon‚Äù page. Then ask your shipping agent for their cost for each option. Then add the costs from Amazon and the shipping agents together for each option to compare the totals for each.

I did this with 3 different shipping agents and it always came out to be cheaper to choose the partial-shipment split option. 

But just a heads up, Amazon announced they are removing that option starting Feb 20th, 2025. So future comparisons should be easier.

Hope this helps!

  - 2025-01-15 | Hi Eleni, I suggest you adjust your shipping times for FBM orders to avoid any negative marks towards your seller account.

To adjust shipping times on Amazon FBM (Fulfilled by Merchant), go to your Seller Central account, navigate to "Settings" > "Shipping Settings" > "General Shipping Settings" where you can modify your default handling time, which determines how many business days you have to prepare and ship an order.

  - 2024-02-01 | ### Accountability and Participation

1. **Participation Policy** ‚ö†Ô∏è: Members are given three opportunities to align with our community standards and processes. Non-compliance may lead to warnings, with the third warning resulting in removal from the program. To date, we are proud to have retained all members across our classes.
2. **Commitment to Promises** üîÑ: Uphold your commitments within the community. Reliability and accountability are key to mutual success.

### Availability and Support

1. **Support Hours** üïí:
    - Monday to Friday: 8 AM - 7 PM
    - Saturday: 10 AM - 5 PM Central Standard Time (CST)
2. **Office Hours** üè¢: Available after each group coaching call. For example, if a Product Research group call is from 8-9 AM, office hours will be held from 9 AM until 10 AM. While we strive to respond promptly, please allow us 1-3 office hours for a response.

Adhering to these guidelines with the added visual cues ensures a productive, respectful, and supportive community environment at Shifu‚Äôs Academy. We are here to support your growth and success.
  - 2024-02-01 | ### **Professional Code of Conduct and Guidelines for Shifu‚Äôs Academy**

### Identification and Profile Standards

1. **Username Policy** üìõ: Members are required to use their real names as their usernames to foster a transparent and trustworthy environment.
2. **Profile Picture Requirement** üñº: Please upload a professional and positive image of yourself for your profile picture to enhance community engagement.

### Community Engagement and Respect

1. **Mutual Respect** ü§ù: Respect within the community is paramount. Engage with others professionally and courteously to maintain a positive and supportive environment.
2. **Commitment to Success** üåü: Have faith in the process. Our goal is to support your success and growth throughout your journey with us.
3. **Supportive Behavior** üëê: Be a pillar of support for fellow members. Offer assistance and constructive feedback whenever possible.
4. **Integrity and Honesty** üìú: Communicate truthfully and with integrity. Honesty builds the foundation of a strong community.
5. **Action-Oriented Conduct** üí™: Prioritize actions over words. Focus on contributing positively and actively to the community and your personal growth.

### Communication and Issue Resolution

1. **Direct Communication** üìû: Should you encounter any issues or require assistance, please reach out directly to our Shifus or the Client Success Manager.
2. **Positive Communication** ‚ú®: Avoid spreading misinformation or negativity. Strive to contribute positively to the community's atmosphere.

  - 2024-02-29 | New comers ALERT üö®
Below is some important key points that will give you a higher chance to succeed in this journey.

1. Commiment: I know you guys have your life duties, but please commit to this journey and stay focus for the next 6 months.

2. Accountability: Keep yourself accountable, stay dedicated and put in the work required. Find an accountability partner will help as well. Remember, you're not in it alone, reach out for help when you face challenges.

3. Mindset: I wanna emphasize this is not an easy path. You willl for sure face a lot of challenges, roadblocks, and setbacks. But as long as you keep moving forward and don't quit, you'll find your way to success. Join Monday class with Shifu Charlie will help strengthening your mindset.

4. Stay Coachable: We can't teach people who don't have an open mind to learn new things. Once you get all the basic knowledge down, you can learn on your own all you want. But at first, listen to what we teach. My goal is to make you guys become more successful than me, so rest assure that I'll teach you everything I know as long as you listen.

---Thank you and let's get sh** done--

  - 2024-12-11 | Second topic:
How to get more review with Vine
1. Create a entirely new listing exactly the same with your main listing
2. Send some inventory in <30
3. Sign up for Vine
4. After gettting the reviews, we can combine that new listing with the main listing under a same parent and reviews will be combine
```c
Implementation detail for step 4: Contact me when you're ready.
```
  - 2024-12-11 | 1.  Design your insert card so that it doesn't say anything related to "review, free gift". You only need 1 good reason for people to scan the qrcode. "Warranty" or "Free Ebook" is good enough. Don't include anything that could trigger their attention.
2. Inside Manychat flow, the first message is to give what you promise on the insert. You can ask for review later in the flow. We do this in case we got caught we can disconnect the later messages to prepare for an appeal.
3. Worst case if you get caught, do NOT admit anything, simply play dumb and try to appeal saying that the Insert card is a marketing strategy to give people more value in hope of referrals.
4. If they still deny, we can withdraw inventory and remove insert card then send it back, we can submit withdrawal IDs and submit prevention letter. The goal is to not lose the listing.
```cpp
Summary: Your insert card is the first gateway of them determine if you violate, so be cautious with what you put on there
```

  - 2024-10-30 | Homework for this week. (Pre and Post launch members ONLY)
Watch the class recording (the part toward the end) and write a short document explaining why would you need a combination of Air/Sea shipping? Use the questions below to write your document
1. What are the cases that you would need shipment come in early?
2. What is the price difference?
3. How to determine the % that sent by air?
4. How would it benefit you?
5. What are the goals of your choices? Does it make sense financially?
6. If you have already launched, how much and how would you order for your next shipment?

  - 2024-12-13 | @AliceSvensson  "Super happy I could join class today, thanks for a intresting class.  Just one question... I know that you often dosent recommend launching the product in differens variations or colours. Is it much more difficult? Should I go with just one colour to start with? Even if I think that it will add more value to my offer if I can sell my product in different colours?" 
Launching variations is possible but it requires more work and capital invested, which is why we don't recommend unless there's a strong reason that makes it make sense
we can always add more variation later if needed
but again, it depends, we can't launch a shirt with just size Medium
But generally speaking, your first product is better to just have 1 variation because you still need time to learn and having multiple variations will just make it harder

Here is the link to her gofundme page directly:

https://www.gofundme.com/f/beyond-borders-building-hope-for-the-umayamnons?utm_campaign=p_lico+share-sheet&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_source=customer

Hats off to you guys! üëè

  - 2024-01-31 | 
  - 2024-01-31 | Hi All! Today is the last day of our official fundraiser. We didn't hit our goal, but we made some good progress. And I am super appreciative of the Shifu Family. Y'all donated half of what was raised, so super thank you to you all! And thank you to the Shifu's for allowing me this platform to share. Also,  I wanted to share the winners of a drawing contest I held for January. The kids' age ranged from 6-20 that participated. Here are the 1st and 2nd place winners in each age group. 1st place won 1000pesos = $18 and 2nd place won 300pesos= $5.50. Not huge prizes in regards to U.S. dollars, but in pesos, that's significant. These prizes were personally funded by me and doesn't come out of the donated funds from the GoFundMe fundraiser. I will continue to keep the fundraiser active should anyone else like to donate in the future, but I won't be soliciting on here anymore out of respect of other charity initiatives.  https://gofund.me/bca9ef76 . Thank you all!
  - 2024-01-27 | Here's a quick update on our tutoring hall. We are installing our railing leading to the tutoring hall today. It's the last piece of the facility to be installed. Thank you to those who donated. We still are hoping to hit our $5k by next month, but if not, we will still make things happen. The kids are worth it. Thank you for letting me share.
  - 2024-01-24 | Some of the kids that will be attending our tutoring hall wanted to say Thank You to our donors and future donors. You're making a huge difference.
  - 2024-01-22 | Here's a short video of our kids starting to use the hall for a drawing contest I've created for them. They are so excited to use the room and the supplies we have. Most of their classrooms are packed with 50+ kids in a room with no Air Conditioning. Right now we can only afford fans but that's fine for now. It will get warmer during the summer. We focus primarily on kids that can't afford to go to school or struggle to keep up with their lessons. The education system there tends to push kids into the next grade even if they aren't understanding well. This is why we have 7th graders here that still struggle to read or write. And parents are encouraged to teach their kids what their teachers don't, however, they don't know how to read or write themselves. So we hope this will be a beacon of hope for the kids in our village to have a proper education so they can have a chance to prosper.
  - 2024-01-22 | Quick update. Thanks everyone who has donated so far. We raised enough funds for a printer and paper! Here's my mom with our new printer. I'm very grateful to have her help since I run all purchases through her since she's there. We will now be able to print out handouts, enrollment forms, and other learning material for the kids. Thank you!
  - 2024-01-22 | 
  - 2024-01-22 | Thank you Shifu Family for donating to the charity work we are doing in the Philippines. Thank you to Susan Hang, Linh Doan, Joan Lovelle Alfeche, Davis Truong, Michael Lee and Phuong Nguyen for donating so far! You've gotten us even closer to our goal. Our fundraiser is still going until February, so if you'd still like to contribute, please visit our GoFundMe link. We now have enough funds to buy a printer and some school supplies, so your money is already being put to great use. üôÇ . https://gofund.me/bca9ef76

  - 2024-12-18 | 
  - 2025-02-15 | Weekly Plan for Amazon Business

A. Reflection  
Of the goals I set last week, I made some progress, but there were a few delays and distractions that slowed me down. I advanced in watching the module videos. 

This Week's Goals
1. Continue Watching Module Videos While Waiting for Product Information from Macy:  
   - Action Steps:  
     - Dedicate uninterrupted time daily to watch and take notes from the module videos.  
     - Use the waiting period to deepen understanding of Manychat.

2. Create a Social Page for the Business:  
   - Action Steps:  
     - Set up the page with a company information and cover photo.  
     - Prepare and schedule a few introductory posts to build your brand presence.

3. Setup Bank Account for Amazon Business:  
   - Action Steps:  
     - Gather necessary documents (e.g., business registration, identification) for chase bank account setup
     - Initiate the application process and also apply for credit card.
  - 2025-02-02 | Weekly Plan

A. Reflection
Of the goals I set last week, I made lots of progress but didn't fully achieve everything. Will carry over the incomplete tasks into this week's plan while adding new priorities.  

- Last Week's Goals and Progress:
  1. Finalize Supplier Research and Take Action ‚Äî Shortlisted five suppliers and requested information from three, but still waiting for responses from some. Need to follow up and assess sample quality.  
  2. Create dummy listing - created the dummy listing but some information were missing which did not let me submit it successfully. Gathering more information from suppliers to create a proper listing. 

- Main Roadblocks/Distractions:  
  1. Delays in supplier responses due to holiday in China. 
  2. Struggled with supplier's product selection and choosing the right product from different catalogue.  

- Solutions/Actions to Reduce Roadblocks:
  1. Set a deadline for choosing a supplier based on available responses instead of waiting indefinitely.  
  2. Create a structured daily schedule with dedicated time blocks for key business activities.  

B. Next Week's Goals

1. Finalize Supplier and Order Samples**  
   - Follow up with suppliers who haven't responded.  
   - Compare catalogue products to inquire more information about pricing, quality, and features.  
   - Select one or two suppliers to move forward with and request for samples.  

2. Refine Time Management and Continue Atomic Habits  
   - Set dedicated focus hours for supplier research, branding, and learning.

  - 2025-02-10 | Have been traveling this weekend for my birthday but made sure to fit in pushups every day
  - 2025-02-03 | I think I got a bit too comfortable with just checking bid prices and nothing past that. Especially with holiday festivities, my mind was elsewhere.

I was being too passive in my approach and after our call at the beginning of the year, I wanted to start taking a more active position. 

Outside of cutting off and managing bleeders, I looked deeper into where my spend was actually going and noticed that my ASINs were overspending by a significant amount compared to my other campaigns. I looked through every ASIN on amazon and found that 10 out of my 15 original ASIN targets were actually not actively selling on amazon -- but the campaign was still spending money on them. My ACOS was already starting to improve just by managing bleeders, but after turning off the inactive ASINS, I started seeing my ACOS % drop significantly.
  - 2025-02-03 | I wanted to share a win with everyone. Over the last 3 weeks I've been locking in on optimizing my campaigns and I've been able to reduce my ACOS from a crazy 414% down to 91%. I'm excited to see continual improvement with some of my campaigns having single digit % ACOS.

Next target will be to get it under 50%! üöÄ
  - 2025-01-07 | Congrats!!

  - 2024-11-08 | Hey brother, thanks for checking in, I will have it submitted this weekend!

Let‚Äôs Do More Together!

What Happened?
Storm Yagi hit Vietnam with devastating force, leaving entire communities in ruins. Heavy rains and winds displaced thousands, flooding homes and destroying vital infrastructure. Many families are now left without shelter, food, or access to medical care. The destruction is widespread, with entire villages submerged under water and roads washed away. The storm has created a humanitarian crisis, and immediate relief is critical to help these communities rebuild and recover. Your support can bring hope to those affected by this disaster.

How Can We Help?


Dear AMZ Shifu family,

We‚Äôve already donated $4,000 to aid the victims of Storm Yagi in Vietnam, but the need is still overwhelming. Thousands of families have lost their homes and are in urgent need of support. We‚Äôre now reaching out to our incredible community to join us in making a bigger difference.

  - 2025-01-08 | A parent listing is a non-buyable entity that is used to relate to child (variant) products. Parent listings are given a unique ASIN that is used to identify the product grouping, but the listing is only displayed within the brand owner‚Äôs Seller Central search results.

Check in here to let us know how close you were to the goals you set at the beginning of this week to receive accountability coaching/support to move the needle forward in your business. REMEMBER, you don't have to be perfect or hit all your goals week to week.  As long as you are 1% more than the week before, that's what matters This journey is a marathon, not a sprint! 

[do this each week] Answer the questions below:

A. Reflection: 
Are you able to hit the goals that you have set from the beginning of the week?

-If you have -> I want you to reward yourself with a treat (either eating at your fav restaurant or watching your fav movie) 

If you haven't -> I want you to still reward yourself with 50 squats /pushups, though, remember, at least you paid up and know that you can restart and get rid of the sense of guilt inside.

Reflect on what are the MAIN roadblocks/distractions from the previous week that you were facing. ( BE HONEST; WE ARE FAMILY. 

Share it and receive suggestions from those who have solved it)

What are the two possible solutions/actions that you will take to reduce/remove/replace these roadblocks or distractions so you can move closer to your goal?

-Share your MAIN WHYS to remind yourself of why you are on this journey. 

B.Planning next week's goal: 
What stage are you on this journey?

-What are your three main goals to focus on that will move the needle forward (the 20% that generate 80% results) ?

What support processes do you need to make that happen?

Post below so we can follow up with you and help you move forward. If you don't post below, it will be hard for all of our coaches and support to check in with you. so do me a favor POST ‚ù§Ô∏è @everyone

What support processes do you need to make that happen?

  - 2025-01-23 | 12 rules for Founders to live happily and successfully! 

1. You will always have problems. Learn to enjoy life while solving them.  

2. People don‚Äôt decide their future; they decide their habits, and their habits decide their future.  

3. In life, you can only control two things: your effort and your attitude.  

4. Don‚Äôt ask how to start. Start, and then ask how to improve.  

5. Happiness has less to do with pleasure and more to do with purpose.  

6. Life is harder when you expect too much from the world and too little from yourself.  

7. Life gets easier when you expect a lot from yourself and little from the world. High standards, low expectations.  

8. Half of your problems are simply your mind turning minor issues into major ones.  

9. Don‚Äôt look for secrets when what you need is repetition.  

10. Don‚Äôt let yourself be controlled by three things: people, money, or past experiences.  

11. In every challenge or even tragedy, there‚Äôs an opportunity. If you train yourself to find the opportunity, you can take control of the situation and even turn it into something positive‚Äîor, if it cannot be entirely good, at least something good can come from it.  

12. Be thankful every day, because even if you feel there‚Äôs nothing to be grateful for, your ‚Äúnormal‚Äù day is someone else‚Äôs dream.

  - 2025-01-16 | I once heard about a boy who loved climbing trees. He wasn‚Äôt the best at it, though. Every time he tried, he‚Äôd slip, scrape his knees, and sulk at the base of the tree, feeling like a failure. One day, an old man passing by stopped and asked, ‚ÄúWhy do you keep giving up, boy?‚Äù

The boy frowned and said, ‚ÄúBecause it‚Äôs too hard. Every time I try, I fall.‚Äù

The old man chuckled. ‚ÄúWhen I was your age, I couldn‚Äôt climb trees either. I fell so many times I stopped counting. But you know what I learned?‚Äù

The boy looked up, curious.

‚ÄúI learned that the moment I wanted to quit was always the moment just before I got better. You‚Äôre not failing‚Äîyou‚Äôre training.‚Äù

The boy scratched his head. ‚ÄúBut what if I fall again?‚Äù

‚ÄúThen you get back up. Giving up doesn‚Äôt protect you from falling. It just guarantees you‚Äôll never reach the top.‚Äù

The boy stared at the tree. The branches seemed to whisper encouragement. This time, when he climbed, he didn‚Äôt care about falling. He focused on one branch at a time, higher and higher.

Eventually, he made it to the top. And from up there, he saw something he‚Äôd never noticed before‚Äîthe view was worth every scrape.

Giving up is easy because it feels like safety. But just like the boy, every time you feel like quitting, remind yourself: you‚Äôre not failing‚Äîyou‚Äôre training. The next branch might be the one that changes everything. Don‚Äôt give up on yourself. Keep climbing.

  - 2025-01-07 | Stay Disciplined  üí™üí°
1. Eliminate Comfort Zones - Force yourself into challenging situations to grow. Avoid excuses or environments that enable laziness.

2. Cut Off Distractions Completely - Disconnect from what is unnecessary for you, avoid non-productive activities‚Äîeven if it feels extreme.

3. Create Unbreakable Rules - Set strict boundaries for yourself and follow them without compromise, no matter how uncomfortable it gets.

4. Wake Up Early Every Day - Set an early alarm and get up immediately, even if you‚Äôre tired. Use the extra time for productive tasks.

5. Punish Laziness - Impose consequences for failing to stick to your goals, such as donating money, skipping leisure activities, or fasting.

6. Say No Relentlessly - Deny any request or activity that doesn‚Äôt align with your priorities, even if it offends or disappoints others.

7. Work Through Discomfort - Push yourself to complete tasks, even when you‚Äôre tired, unmotivated, or facing setbacks.

8. Limit Socializing With The Wrong People  - Reduce interactions with people who don‚Äôt support your goals, even if it means distancing yourself from friends or family.

9. Track and Confront Failures - keep a record of every missed deadline or failure and review it regularly to remind yourself of the consequences of slacking.

10. Avoid Overindulgence - deny yourself unnecessary pleasures, such as excessive food, entertainment, or luxury, to maintain focus and discipline.

... Just Keep Trying....

Discipline often requires tough love‚Äîembrace the struggle to reap the rewards.

Here are three tips to help improve focus 

1.Minimize Distractions: Create a quiet, clutter-free workspace and turn off notifications on your devices.

2.Set Specific Goals: Break tasks into smaller, manageable steps and set clear, achievable goals for each session.

3.Practice Mindfulness: Engage in mindfulness or meditation exercises to train your brain to stay present and focused.

  - 2024-12-13 | Another Travel tips for @everyone  this holiday when check in hotel.I always love Hyatt, have an account with them when booking. 

1. Always be nice smile, ask how the checkin agent days. It takes practice to be genuine and flow.

2. Ask if there's any complimentary upgrade available while sliding a $20-100 with a smile to take care of them. Have small little chat.

$20 you get complimentary extra services

$100: you may get suite upgrade

  - 2024-12-12 | Lounge hack for Amazon digital nomads:

#senerios: i traveled from DFW -SFO to pick my mom up.
(Note: this work all airport in america with SE carrier)
She didn't landed until 8pm and I have already at the SFO.

Problem: I need food and a lounge work yet I don't have a next flight in order to have a boarding past to check in the lounge with my priority pass from Amex.

Solution: I booked a one way , same day 3-4 hours ahead flight from SFO - LAS with 

-Southwest (they are pretty easy on 24h cancellation no charge )

-once I checked in the lounge, I cancellled the flight.

Notes: do this at moderate frequencies. Don't overdo I would recommend 1-3 time max a year to avoid being terminated. 

Happy travel with your loved ones , Amazon warriors , for your holidays

LFGGG!! 1% BEFD
  - 2024-12-28 | Scaling and Launching Multiple Products

  - Create SOPs for inventory management, customer service, etc. before scaling
  - Hire 1 dedicated VA per product launched
  - Ensure first product is running smoothly (automated, profitable) before launching second
  - Monitor KPIs closely when scaling

Avoiding Distractions and Staying Focused

  - Be aware of "shiny object syndrome" (e.g., crypto, dropshipping trends)
  - Use vision boards and financial planning sheets to stay grounded
  - Only diversify when primary business is stable and predictable

Time Management and Productivity

  - Create detailed daily/weekly schedules for business tasks
  - Delegate non-core tasks in personal life (e.g., childcare, cooking)
  - Simplify daily decisions (e.g., wardrobe) to save mental energy
  - Regular self-reflection and progress review (daily meditation, weekly review)

Next Steps

  - Participants to share key takeaways in chat and post class notes in Discord
  - Share upcoming workshop details on social media to invite friends/network
  - Consider referring others to the program for commission ($500 per signup)
  - Practice due diligence and avoid jumping to conclusions in business relationships
  - 2024-12-28 | Topics

Opening Exercises and Meditation

  - Group performed 10 squats and a brief dance party to energize
  - 20-breath meditation focusing on identifying and replacing negative thoughts
  - Emphasis on daily practice to build mental discipline and manage anxiety

Virtual Assistant (VA) Management

  - Low-skill VAs in Philippines/Vietnam cost $3-5/hour; high-skill ~$10/hour
  - Create detailed job descriptions (JDs) before hiring
  - Start with basic tasks to learn management, then scale up
  - Use platforms like Upwork for hiring; interview at least 3 candidates
  - Test potential hires with weekend tasks to assess proactivity and work ethic

Transitioning from 9-5 Job to Full-time Business

  - Keep 9-5 job until business consistently replaces income (6+ months)
  - Build 6-12 month emergency fund before quitting
  - Use 9-5 income to test and validate business model
  - Aim for $10k/month revenue with $1k profit after 3 months for first product
  - 2024-12-28 | PLS Weekly Mentoring Session - December 28
VIEW RECORDING: 
Meeting Purpose

Weekly mentoring session covering key lessons for scaling an Amazon business and avoiding common pitfalls after initial product launch success.

Key Takeaways

  - Don't quit your 9-5 job until your business income consistently replaces it and you've built a 6-12 month emergency fund
  - Build strong operational systems and hire dedicated VAs before scaling to multiple products
  - Stay focused on your core business; avoid "shiny object syndrome" and only diversify when your primary income is stable and predictable

  - 2025-02-20 | Great read - Jeff Bezo's last letter to shareholders as ceo
 https://www.aboutamazon.com/news/company-news/2020-letter-to-shareholders

tldr;

"Differentiation is Survival and the Universe Wants You to be Typical

 In what ways does the world pull at you in an attempt to make you normal? How much work does it take to maintain your distinctiveness? To keep alive the thing or things that make you special?

The world wants you to be typical ‚Äì in a thousand ways, it pulls at you. Don‚Äôt let it happen.

You have to pay a price for your distinctiveness, and it‚Äôs worth it. The fairy tale version of ‚Äúbe yourself‚Äù is that all the pain stops as soon as you allow your distinctiveness to shine. That version is misleading. Being yourself is worth it, but don‚Äôt expect it to be easy or free. You‚Äôll have to put energy into it continuously.

The world will always try to make Amazon more typical ‚Äì to bring us into equilibrium with our environment. It will take continuous effort, but we can and must be better than that. "

  - 2025-01-26 | as for how i negotiate for better pricing on each bulk order, there are a few things to consider 

1. your order has to be bigger than the previous order

2. if using a sourcing agent, simply ask along these lines (rephrase as fit)

given the increase in units on this order, my boss has asked if there's any way we can get better pricing?

if they push back, do the below üëá 

3. if negotiating with supplier directly, you need to paint the picture of growth. show how well/quickly your first batch sold out, how quickly you stole market share from competitors, explain that you need cash flow for growth and how the supplier will be a partner in that growth. if possible, mention % increase you're expecting to order on upcoming batches.

  - 2024-10-11 | <@809813064756887582> post your info here so han can get you added to private channel
  - 2025-02-15 | just piggybacking on minh's response in case you're looking for more details.

when you ship to amazon, amazon will charge you placement fee. that placement fee is different whether you're shipping to 1 vs 3 vs 5 locations. usually the placement fee will be most expensive to 1 location and cheapest to 5 locations.

when you're getting shipping quotes, we usually recommend just picking one location closest to where you live just so you can have a frame of reference for calculating your margin.

after you place your bulk order, it's time to get real shipping quotes. you will first need to create the shipping plan in amazon, which will then give you the placement fees AND the exact warehouses to ship your goods to. 

you can give those warehouses to your supplier and other shipping agents to get an exact quote. yes, you can add them all up to see how they compare to the one location + placement fee scenario.

  - 2025-02-11 | that's incredible that you were profitable on your first batch! i wasn't net positive until my third batch. capital is definitely going to be an ongoing problem. some ways i've been working through this:

- continue opening credit cards. my husband and i have 7 opened between the two of us ü§Ø 
- justin is a fan of asking friends & family for money and paying the loan with interest
- i have invested in whole life insurance and will be pulling capital to continue funding
- open a business line of credit with your local bank
- don't run out of stock anymore because your cash flow will be even more tight
- negotiate for better payment terms (try to ask your supplier not to final amount until after goods arrive to amazon OR 30 days after the goods arrive to amazon - usually you will need to be doing higher volume for this)
- find a partner. they will have to put $$$ up front for a % of ownership

  - 2025-01-06 | saw you just moved this here. 

han might have a more efficient method, but here's what i would do:

1. Create a dummy campaign (you don‚Äôt need to activate it).
Add keywords relevant to your category or add categories, and Amazon will suggest bid ranges and estimated CPCs based on competition.

2. Helium 10 (Cerebro)
Helps you find keywords with their estimated CPC and search volume.
Look for low-CPC, high-converting keywords in smaller niches.
This only helps for keywords not categories but you will get an idea of the category if you segment your keywords accordingly
