  - 2025-01-20 | Saturday Class session 1/11 Notes

Key Takeaways
Atomic Habits - Small changes compound over time.
Willpower isn‚Äôt enough. Design your environment to make good habits easier: Delete distracting apps, Remove temptation 
Create small, manageable challenges with clear rewards or punishments to stay motivated.
Stick to a structured daily schedule to maximize productivity.
Look to successful community members for inspiration.
Make positive  actions as easy as possible ( one click away) to increase follow-through.
Have a VA to manage your social media, to free up time for more important activities.
Practiced meditation to sharpen focus and reduce stress.
Watch or listen to positive and inspiring content to stay in a good mindset.
Positive self-talk and visualize success to maintain motivation.
Use Helium 10 for competitor analysis and listing optimization.
Key metrics to track: sales, organic vs. ad revenue, and overall profit margins.
Find an accountability partner in the community to help stay on track.
  - 2024-12-28 | Shifu emphasized the importance of not jumping to conclu sions about someone based on somthing you don‚Äôt like or a rumor you‚Äôve heard. In busines, it‚Äôs always better to make friends than enemie because you never know when you might need their support. Keep an open mind, avoid burning bridges, and ap proach relationships with understanding and respect.
  - 2024-12-28 | Make daily/weekly schedules for business tasks.
Ask mom for help with daily task at home
Simplify life decision: Only wear black and white shirt, have fewer options for daily life
  - 2024-12-28 | Time management
  - 2024-12-28 | Shiny object syndrome
  - 2024-12-28 | Hire VAs based on skill:
Low-skill: $3-5/hour (Philippines/Vietnam).
High-skill: ~$10/hour.
Start small: Test people with weekend tasks for proactivity and work ethic.
Use clear job descriptions  for hiring.
When to Leave the Day Job
Don‚Äôt quit until:
Business income is steady for 6 months or more.
Emergency fund is ready: Have atleast 6 months of income in the bank.
Use job income to fund and test my business ideas.
Scaling Smartly
First product needs to be smooth and profitable before launching the next.
Create SOPs before scaling.
Hire one VA per product as I expand.
Avoiding Distractions
  - 2024-12-28 | Don‚Äôt Quit the 9-5 Too Soon:

Wait until my business income consistently matches or exceeds my job income.
Build a 6-12 month emergency fund before making the leap.
Systems First, Then Scale:

Build strong operational systems and hire reliable VAs before adding more products.
Stay Focused:

Avoid shiny object syndrome (crypto, dropshipping, etc.).
Only diversify when my primary business is stable and predictable.

  - 2025-02-04 | From my experience with ordering samples, it‚Äôs okay to use slower shipping for the first one or two since it will take some time to find more suppliers anyway. Once you've got a few options lined up, you can choose faster shipping for the 3rd or 4th sample. This way, all the samples will arrive around the same time, and you‚Äôll save some money with slower shipping on the first few.

  - 2025-01-28 | The FBA fees might not be accurate if the product is currently out of stock.
  - 2025-01-28 | Only refferal fees are about the same. FBM doesn't have storage fees and shipping fees.
  - 2025-01-24 | I did what Chloe and Trish did with their supplier. Besides having a term in your contract for handling returns or warranty claims, building that personal relationship with your supplier makes a big difference. They‚Äôre usually happy to send spare parts, boxes, accessories, and sometimes even extra units. These can be used for warranty claims or repacking for resale. It‚Äôs easier for them to do that upfront rather than have you contact them every time you need something. You just have to pay for the shipping to get the goods sent to you. They like it when you keep it simple for them, and it‚Äôs a win-win because you get what you need to keep your business running smoothly.

  - 2025-01-14 | Hey sis! To update your email on Amazon Seller Central, log in and go to Settings , Account Info, then under Business Information, select Login Settings. From there, edit the email field, enter your new business email, and save the changes. Be sure to verify the new email. If you‚Äôre setting up an LLC, don‚Äôt forget to update your business details in the same section.
  - 2025-01-28 | The FBA fees might not be accurate if the product is currently out of stock.
  - 2025-01-28 | Only refferal fees are about the same. FBM doesn't have storage fees and shipping fees.
  - 2025-01-24 | I did what Chloe and Trish did with their supplier. Besides having a term in your contract for handling returns or warranty claims, building that personal relationship with your supplier makes a big difference. They‚Äôre usually happy to send spare parts, boxes, accessories, and sometimes even extra units. These can be used for warranty claims or repacking for resale. It‚Äôs easier for them to do that upfront rather than have you contact them every time you need something. You just have to pay for the shipping to get the goods sent to you. They like it when you keep it simple for them, and it‚Äôs a win-win because you get what you need to keep your business running smoothly.

  - 2025-01-07 | I‚Äôve added four shoppable influencers to the list. They collaborate free of charge‚Äîyou just need to send them your product. They don‚Äôt work with a script, as their review videos have a more authentic, natural flow. What I do is send a letter along with the product, outlining its benefits, features, and expressing gratitude. These influencers are professionals who typically do this on the side, so they can be selective about the products they choose to promote or review. However, their video content is very informative. If your niche requires educating customers with a lot of information, these influencers could be a great fit. Hope this helps!

  - 2025-02-17 | Hi Mercede
When you apply an Amazon coupon, the 15% referral fee is calculated based on the discounted price, not the original price.
For example, if your item is originally priced at $60 and you offer a $10 coupon, the referral fee and FBA fee will be based on the $50 sale price, not the $60 original price.

What is the price difference?

How would it benefit you?
What are the goals of your choices? Does it make sense financially?
If you have already launched, how much and how would you order for your next shipment?

  - 2025-01-01 | Yes you can put SKU barcode on package design
  - 2025-01-01 | 
  - 2025-01-01 | 
  - 2025-01-01 | Hi sister <@173853354374463489> , Happy New Year to you and your family!
Yu will need to provide for your supplier two labels
1. SKU barcode: This label for tracking and quick identification of the product. it will apply on your packaging box.
2. FBA Shipping label: This label for sending products to Amazon's fulfillment centers
  - 2024-12-23 | When you choose the West inbound, Amazon will randomly assign the warehouse location. Maybe California , Washington or Arizona warehouse.
  - 2024-12-23 | The price of shipping to the western address is cheapest
  - 2024-12-23 | 
  - 2024-12-23 | Amazon has many fulfillment centers across the U.S and they will assign the most suitable fulfillment center based on your product's category, size, and demand. They will offer three options: 
1. Five shipment different warehouse (east, west, central) with no inbound fee
2. Two shipment, you can pick the inbound region (east, west, central) and pay the inbound fee
3. One shipment, you can pick the inbound region (east, west, central) and pay the inbound fee

  - 2024-12-31 | Hi Ivy, I recommend writing down the pros and cons of the top seller (old model) and the new seller (new model). While the new product seems to be receiving a positive reception based on reviews, the fact that it‚Äôs new doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean it will maintain its momentum. Take a look at customer reviews for both the new product and the old one. Are there any unmet needs or complaints that you can address in your design? If you find any common pain points, you can focus on solving them in your model and add valuable bundles, which might give you an edge.

  - 2025-01-04 | You can put in the US with any zip code
  - 2025-01-04 | Hi <@1302992418341261386> 

Yes, the "deliver to" location can matter when using both Amazon and Helium10

For Amazon, the delivery address impacts factors like shipping fees, delivery time, and product availability. Some sellers might only offer shipping to specific countries or regions, and the product price could vary based on the delivery location. Helium 10 show different results based on your location, reflecting region-specific demand or competition.

  - 2024-12-13 | you can choose the downgrade to the individual selling plan now until you start to bulk order and upgrade to the professional plan
  - 2024-12-13 | Yes please choose downgrade
  - 2024-12-12 | You haven't started selling on Amazon yet, so change to an individual selling plan and you won't bear a subscription fee per month
  - 2024-12-12 | Hi <@1302992418341261386> 
For Amazon sellers, a monthly subscription fee typically refers to the cost of using Amazon's selling platform. There are two main types of selling accounts, each with its associated subscription fee:

1. Individual Selling Plan:
No monthly fee: You don't pay a monthly subscription fee, but you will incur a $0.99 fee per item sold (in addition to other selling fees like referral fees and shipping costs).
This plan is best for sellers who expect to sell fewer than 40 items per month.

2. Professional Selling Plan:
$39.99 per month 
This plan allows you to sell more than 40 items per month, and it comes with additional features like access to Amazon‚Äôs advertising tools, bulk listing, and advanced reporting.
